books.title: The Able McLaughlins
books.author: Margaret Wilson
books.summary: The eldest son of Scottish immigrants farming the Iowa prairie struggles to help his soon-to-be wife recover from the violent act that could ruin both of their lives.

books.title: The Black Arrow
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: During the War of the Roses, a young knight must rescue his lady and find out who killed his father.

books.title: Our Nig
books.author: Harriet E. Wilson
books.summary: An autobiographical account of a young biracial girl abandoned by her parents and forced into servitude in the northern United States.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Wind in the Willows
books.author: Kenneth Grahame
books.summary: Four animals adventure through the bucolic English countryside.

books.title: Something New
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Two young writers experience romance and adventure in Lord Emsworth’s Blandings Castle.

books.title: The Comedy of Errors
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two sets of identical twins are mistaken for their lost siblings.

books.title: The Story of the Amulet
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Four children are reunited with an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures through time with a magic amulet.

books.title: Greenmantle
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: The story of a chase through war-torn Europe to prevent an uprising during the First World War.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: Twelve Years a Slave
books.author: Solomon Northup
books.summary: The account of a free black man kidnapped in 1841 and sold into slavery, from which it took twelve years to free himself.

books.title: The Sign of the Four
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: An analytical detective is consulted by a young woman who has received a strange communication regarding her long-missing father and a mysterious treasure.

books.title: Walden
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: Thoreau’s report on his social experiment of solitude, simplicity, and self-reliance.

books.title: The Religion of Nature Delineated
books.author: William Wollaston
books.summary: Wollaston attempts to derive ethics and religion by using rational thought and observation of the natural world, without resorting to revelation or received religion.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: James Joyce
books.summary: A collection of James Joyce’s poetry, ordered by date of first publication.

books.title: Martin Eden
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A young working-class man sets out to become a bourgeois writer.

books.title: Plague of Pythons
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A man navigates a world torn apart by bouts of spontaneous, unexplained possessions.

books.title: Darby O’Gill and the Good People
books.author: Herminie Templeton Kavanagh
books.summary: When Tipperary man Darby O’Gill is imprisoned by the fairies of Sleive-na-mon in their home under the hollow mountain, he starts a lasting friendship with their King Brian Connors.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.
